speaker: MRS KERNOF
line: Good Evening, Father.

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: Is she ready?

speaker: MRS KERNOFF
line: Yes.

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: Baptism is the rite of initiation. This holy water takes away original sin. The sacrament confers the grace of god … bringing the soul into God’s family.

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: Dara, I baptize you in the name of the Father … and of the Son … and of the Holy Spirit. Bless you my child.

speaker: MR KERNOF
line: Dara? MR KERNOF Oh, my God.

speaker: MR KERNOF
line: Dara?! Dara!

speaker: MR KERNOF
line: Dara! Dara?

speaker: MR KERNOF
line: Oh … Oh, God. Oh, my God. Dara! No! Noooo!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Bless me, Father, for I have sinned. It has been several months since my last confession.

speaker: PRIEST
line: You have a sin to confess?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Father, I’m an FBI agent. I’ve taken it as my code and purpose to uphold the law … to save lives.

speaker: PRIEST
line: And now your work has come in conflict with your faith.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In a way. I was here for Easter services last week and Father McCue approached me for my help.

speaker: PRIEST
line: Why did he come to you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because there was a family that he felt needed my help. But it was more than that. Father, I had a daughter who died … A strange and sudden death several months ago.

speaker: PRIEST
line: Father McCue thought that by helping these people you might in some way help yourself to come to terms with your grief.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: PRIEST
line: But you haven’t.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Father, I told you that I had a sin to confess … But the sin of which I’m guilty … I’m not sure if you can offer forgiveness.

speaker: PRIEST
line: What is the sin?

speaker: SCULLY
line: An innocent girl is dead because of me. I could’ve saved her life, but I let her die.

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: Dana … Do you have a moment? I’d like to speak with you in private.

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: I must say, Dana, it’s been nice seeing you at mass again. I’ve almost started getting used to it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’ve been trying to make an effort to come more often.

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: I don’t mean to take advantage of your attendance, but I’ve become involved in a difficult situation with a couple that are also members here. Do you know the Kernofs?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I’m afraid I don’t.

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: Recently, they lost their daughter, Dara. You may have heard about the situation?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I didn’t.

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: The circumstances of the girl’s death were sudden and I’m afraid the police haven’t been able to tell them much.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you asking for my help?

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: The Kernofs are devout but their faith is giving them little comfort. I thought with your background your words might carry a certain weight. Can I tell them you’ll be visiting?

speaker: MRS KERNOFF
line: That’s Dara on her 16th birthday. We couldn’t have children of our own. I persuaded Lance six years ago to adopt. At first he was reluctant to accept a special needs child, but he became so attached to her. Then this happens. You make the choice never imagining something like this or how vulnerable you are. Dara had just been baptized. I know in my heart she’s gone to a better place, but Lance is angry. Angry at God. They say time heals.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, Father McCue said that, uh, that you’ve been having trouble getting much information about what might have happened to her.

speaker: MRS KERNOFF
line: They say now she may have been struck by lightening but no one seems to know for sure. How she even got out of the house onto the street is a mystery.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MRS KERNOFF
line: Dara suffered from congenital spinal deformities. She’s been wheelchair bound her whole life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Could somebody have taken her out of her room?

speaker: MRS KERNOFF
line: Lance said he saw her walking and that when he found her she was on her knees, praying. I think that’s the hardest part for my husband. He’ll never understand how God could … forsake the life of an innocent girl. How God, in His mercy could let this happen to our Dara.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mrs. Kernof was talking about her husband, but she might as well have been talking about me.

speaker: PRIEST
line: You, too, were angry at God?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I felt drawn to these people, Father … in a very personal way. I was determined to help them understand why their daughter had been taken.

speaker: PRIEST
line: And did you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: As much as I have my faith, Father, I am a scientist trained to weigh evidence… but science only teaches us how … not why.

speaker: CORONER
line: If you want me to stand by my report, I will, but I have to say it’s not exactly open and shut on the cause of death.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think it was lightning?

speaker: CORONER
line: I’m guessing it was lightning, The way her eyes were burned suggests the bolt may have gone to ground right through the top of her head. Funny thing is there was no other sign of arcing except for the face.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Her mother said that she was found in a kneeling position.

speaker: CORONER
line: Genuflecting. Are you a religious person?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why do you ask?

speaker: CORONER
line: I haven’t been to church since I was a kid, but I went last Sunday. I’m going to show you something. Her body was rigored such that I had to do my examination in the position she was found. I’ve never seen anything like it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Looks like there was surgery done on her hands.

speaker: CORONER
line: She was polydactyl. Same with her feet. I haven’t asked her parents yet. Haven’t had the heart to, but I assume they had the extra fingers removed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What’s the connection?

speaker: CORONER
line: I found no other evidence of any other tissue damage of electrical burns or any other serious trauma. It’s as if God Himself struck her down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dara Kernof was adopted. I don’t suppose that you’ve requested any information about the birth mother.

speaker: CORONER
line: I can do that if you like.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, that’s okay. I, uh … I have someone I can ask. Somebody I’d like to confer with, actually.

speaker: ORDERLY
line: Koklos … Koklos … Paula Koklos, room 213. We’ll get her things packed up and get you on your way.

speaker: STARKEY
line: Hold it! Just hold it. Are you Father Gregory?

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: Yes.

speaker: STARKEY
line: I’m Aaron Starkey with the Department of Social Services. I am very sorry but we’ve had a mix-up.

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: STARKEY
line: Your adoption petition for Paula Koklos. It’s missing an approval.

speaker: ORDERLY
line: I’ve got the court order right here.

speaker: STARKEY
line: Well, that’s the mix-up. See, it never should have gone to family court without getting an approval from the social worker assigned to the case, and that’s me.

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: Give it to me here then and we’ll be on our way.

speaker: STARKEY
line: No. I can’t, at least not yet. I’ve just been assigned to Paula, so I’ll need time to familiarize myself with her case…

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: Look, I’ve already been through all this. I’m here to take the girl home.

speaker: STARKEY
line: I’m sorry, Father, but you’ll have to wait … until I can get the paperwork in order.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully. I’m returning your call.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi .. uh, something’s come up. I was, uh, hoping that you could do me a favor.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why? What’s going on?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This isn’t official FBI business so I was hoping that we could keep it outside of work.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, look, I’m, uh … I’m kind of tailing a possible suspect right now, so I’m kind of rushed, so, uh …

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need some birth and adoptive records on a Dara Kernof.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dara Kernof. I can’t tell you much more than that, Mulder. I’m sorry.

speaker: MULDER
line: You want to give me a hint? Anything?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not until you get me those records.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, I’ll talk to you later.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully? Aren’t you the secret squirrel.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What so you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: Just got a look at that body they wheeled out of here. You’ve been holding out on me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it’s not what you think. I - I didn’t want to involve you. I got asked to look into this as a favor for a family.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dara Kernof’s family?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You found Dara’s records?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, those are her birth records. The adoption records have been sealed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think one of my questions has already been answered. Dara was a twin.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Actually she was a quadruplet – one of four girls. Was this, uh … cross found like this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, yes, as far as I know. Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s inverted. Upside down. That’s a protest, a sacrilege against the church.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Put there by whom?

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s your case, remember, Scully? Do you have any suspects?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not as of this time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Could the, uh, the victim have placed it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, it’s doubtful. Paula Koklos was severely impaired -- physically and mentally – as was Dara Kernof.

speaker: MULDER
line: And they both died the same way?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It appears that their eyes were burnt out. Their bodies frozen in a position of prayer.

speaker: MULDER
line: Their physical deformities could account for that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They might.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look, Scully. I know you don’t really want my help on this, but can I offer you my professional opinion? You’ve got a bona-fide, super-crazy, religious wacko on your hands.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What makes you so sure?

speaker: MULDER
line: The mote in the eye, the eyes as windows to the soul, an eye for an eye – he’s working from ancient scripture … ancient text … Maybe even the Bible. He may even think he’s doing God’s work.

speaker: STARKEY
line: Did you find anything? My name is Aaron Starkey. I’m the social worker assigned to Paula Koklos. This is so tragic. I just hope you catch whoever did this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Starkey, do you happen to know if that cross over there belonged to Paula?

speaker: STARKEY
line: I don’t remember seeing it before. I’m sure it didn’t.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did she have any visitors or anybody who might have left it behind?

speaker: STARKEY
line: Well, she had no family. No friends, really. I don’t know if you knew this, but… Paula was about to be adopted.

speaker: SCULLY
line: By who?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, look at this. The Gnostic Gospels, Book of Enoch … Book of J … Apocrypha … I’m surprised there’s nothing here from "Jesus Christ Superstar".

speaker: SCULLY
line: What kind of church is this?

speaker: MULDER
line: There’s no telling.

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: Can I help you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Father Gregory?

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: Yes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m Dana Scully. We’re here about the death of Paula Koklos.

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: Oh …

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you all right, Father?

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: I was trying to adopt Paula. I’m sure you knew that.

speaker: MULDER
line: We hear you were very anxious to do so.

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: I … I hope to God you’re not suggesting I had something to do with it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why adopt her?

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: You think I was interested in harming her?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why adopt her?

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: I - I was trying to protect her. I knew her mother.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you know where she is?

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We were looking for her name. It’s not listed on the girls’ birth records.

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: Why would you want it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The other two girls may be in danger. We’re hoping that she might be able to help is find them.

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: Their mother died in childbirth.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can you give us a name?

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: When I was a priest in the Roman Church, before I founded my own, I was her confessor. Divulging her name would violate the code of my faith … … and yours, I see.

speaker: MULDER
line: You said you wanted to protect Paula. From what?

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: Whatever your intentions … your secular prejudices blind you from seeing what’s really happening here. Two girls are dead … not by the hand of Man. Unless you accept the truth of God’s teachings that there is a struggle between good and evil for All Souls and that we are losing that struggle, you’re but fools rushing in. You put your own lives in danger as well as the lives of the Messengers. I have nothing more to say..

speaker: SCULLY
line: I brought Agent Mulder on the case to help temper my feelings … to keep them from clouding my judgement. I wouldn’t admit it to him, but … as we stood there, I felt as if Father Gregory were speaking directly to me … in a language only I could understand.

speaker: PRIEST
line: The Messengers.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know people in glass houses shouldn’t throw stones, blah, blah, blah, but that guy is paranoid.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think you’re a little extreme in your judgment, don’t you, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: All that crap about the fight for All Souls, the literature we saw in there, the performance we just witnessed – it all fits. He thinks he’s doing God’s laundry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, he said this wasn’t done by the hand of man. Do you think he believes that, too?

speaker: MULDER
line: If he does, he’s even more dangerous than he appears. Even if he’s not your killer, he is hiding something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, he says he knew the mother, but won’t give up her name. Maybe she’s still alive. I think you have enough to bring him in for questioning if not make an arrest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But, basically, you’re ruling out any element of the supernatural?

speaker: MULDER
line: What … do … you… mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, Dara Kernof was baptized on the day of her death. She was sanctified by the ritual sacrament … submerged in the spirit..

speaker: MULDER
line: And why would God allow this to happen. Why do bad things happen to good people? Religion has masqueraded as the paranormal since the dawn of time to justify some of the most horrible acts in history.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was raised to believe that God has His reasons, however mysterious.

speaker: MULDER
line: He may well have His reasons but He seems to use a lot of psychotics to carry out His job orders. You want to find out who did this? I suggest you autopsy the body of Paula Koklos before it’s interred, before the man who killed her has a chance to find her sisters.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The victim is Paula Koklos, age 16, cause of death unknown. I’ll begin with the external examination. Victim has signs of congenital physical defects including four supernumerary digits. The only indications of external trauma are the burning … by means unknown, of both globes of the eyes. I’m noting something on the shoulder – a bony process of some kind, possibly a tumerous mass. No- no indication of surgical procedure. The mass appears on both the right and left clavicle.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, God.

speaker: EMILY
line: Mommy?

speaker: EMILY
line: Mommy, please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I told myself that it was all in my head … a hallucination brought on by my emotional connection to the case.

speaker: PRIEST
line: That would seem to be a reasonable explanation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But that’s not what it was, Father. I was meant to see Emily … for a purpose.

speaker: PRIEST
line: Which was?

speaker: SCULLY
line: To save these girls.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully, it’s me. I did a little more digging on those adoption records.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think I got a lead on that third sister.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where?

speaker: MULDER
line: She was under county care ten years ago. Apparently, she wandered into a teen crisis center here in DC last week, homeless. That guy over at, uh, social services, Starkey – he’s helping me canvas the area.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, Mulder, if she shares anything with her sisters, she wouldn’t be walking anywhere far.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did you find?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There’s evidence of a progressive degenerative bone disease and, uh, I know you’re going to think that I’m crazy … but I swear I found evidence of something winglike.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, then, maybe she flew here, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, there’s something else …

speaker: MULDER
line: Why don’t you hold that thought and tell it to me and Father Gregory when you see us?

speaker: MULDER
line: Stop right there! Move into the light. Move into the light. Hands where I can see them!

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: We’re too late.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where’s the girl?

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: She’s dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is she?

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: In there.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you asking for, Father? Mercy or forgiveness? You know they say when you talk to God it’s prayer, but when God talks to you, it’s schizophrenia. What is your God telling you, Father?

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: I pray for the girls’ souls.

speaker: MULDER
line: You pray for their souls now. That’s convenient.

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: I’m immune to your mockery. You’re not interested in the truth.

speaker: MULDER
line: I am only interested in the truth. I would like to know why you did what you did to three defenseless, helpless young girls. What in your sick mind would possess you to burn their eyes out! Did they see you for who you are, like I do? What does this mean, Father?

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: Tell him what it is.

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: St Peter. You know the story. St Peter on the cross.

speaker: SCULLY
line: St. Peter would only be crucified upside-down out of humility towards Christ.

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: I’ve risked my life to protect their precious souls, which the devil has sought to claim for his own. He took two before I could reach them. I was too late to save the third.

speaker: GUARD
line: Agents Mulder and Scully?

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: You know. You’ve already guessed … what they are. The last one is still out there. The Devil is here and if he finds her, his victory will be complete.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, they think they’ve found the fourth girl.

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: As long as I’m in here, there’s no one to protect her. Let me go … or she will die.

speaker: PRIEST
line: You believed him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: PRIEST
line: But you didn’t tell your colleague.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He believed that he could find the last girl. But I already knew that I was meant to save her.

speaker: PRIEST
line: From what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I wasn’t sure. Father Gregory said that the Devil claimed the lives of the first three girls.

speaker: PRIEST
line: You don’t believe that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know now that Father Gregory was mistaken. The Devil didn’t take their souls, but the threat to those girls was real. And Father Gregory gave his life to protect them.

speaker: MULDER
line: The fourth girl is Roberta Dyer. Transferred to Maryland Adoption Services in 1995 when her foster father got a job in Gaithersburg. Adoption services were called out to investigate allegations of child abuse in September of that year. Three more times in ’96, then two more times in ’97.

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s wrong?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Father Gregory called them Messengers.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully? Scully, don’t let this guy get in your head. That’s the last thing you want. Sometimes the most twisted ones are the most persuasive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, he knows where she is.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that’s okay. As long as he’s locked up here, it doesn’t matter.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’re not going find her. I think you’re being misled.

speaker: MULDER
line: By who? Scully, I think you’re the one who’s being misled. Not just willingly, but willfully. I’ve never seen you more vulnerable or susceptible or more easily manipulated and it scares me because I don’t know why.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I saw Emily. She came to me in a vision.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think you should step away. Personal issues are making you lose your objectivity, clouding your judgement.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You go. Go find the girl. I’m going to finish up with Father Gregory.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay.

speaker: STARKEY
line: Father Gregory. Where is she, Father?

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: How did you get in here?

speaker: STARKEY
line: I will not be denied this time, Father.

speaker: FATHER GREGORY
line: But you took the others.

speaker: STARKEY
line: The others were taken from me. I will not allow that to happen again. Where is the fourth girl?

speaker: STARKEY
line: Tell me, Father. Save yourself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’d like to get back in here.

speaker: GUARD
line: It should be open.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Father Gregory? Father Gregory?

speaker: MULDER
line: We have a warrant to search the premises for your daughter.

speaker: DYER
line: She’s not here. I tell you, she’s out … she’s at school.

speaker: MULDER
line: We checked at school. She hasn’t been there in over a week. We have reason to believe that her life may be in danger. If you know something … What’s behind this door?

speaker: DYER
line: It’s the basement.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, can you unlock it?

speaker: DYER
line: I don’t have the key.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is this her room? Where is she, Mr. Dyer? Where is she?!

speaker: DYER
line: They’re going to cut off the checks, aren’t they?

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is she?!

speaker: DYER
line: He said he’d take her off my hands, but I could keep the disability.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: DYER
line: The priest.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?!

speaker: DYER
line: Father Gregory.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, hi, Scully. It’s me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He’s dead, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Father Gregory. They found him alone in the interrogation room. No one can figure it out. There was a guard sitting right outside the room.

speaker: MULDER
line: We didn’t find her. The fourth girl – she was here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully. Scully, you there? Answer me. Scully? Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Father?

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: Come in, Dana. I understand you found the man responsible for the death of those girls. I’m sure the Kernoffs will be relieved.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m not sure if they should be, Father.

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: Why not?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’ve seen things. Things that have made me question if there aren’t … larger forces at work here.

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: What have you seen?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Visions … of my daughter Emily, for one.

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: I think that’s understandable. I’m sure you identified with the loss.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I considered that, um… but then I saw something last night, which I … Which I can’t explain. I saw a man … in dark clothes … but he had four faces. They weren’t human.

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: Is this what you saw? It’s a Seraphim. An angel … with four faces … Those of a man, a lion, an eagle, and a bull. In the story, the angel descends from heaven and fathers four children with a mortal woman. Their offspring are the Nephilim – The "Fallen Ones." They have the souls of angels but they weren’t meant to be. They’re deformed, tormented. So the Lord sends the Seraphim to Earth to bring back the souls of the Nephilim to keep the Devil from claiming them as his own.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did he bring back their souls?

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: They were smote with the brightness of his countenance. To look upon the Seraphim in all his glory is to give up one’s soul to heaven.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you think that’s what I saw?

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: No. I think what you saw is a figment of your imagination. A half-remembered story from your childhood that surfaced because of this case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But I saw it, Father.

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: Dana, the Nephilim is a story. The text in which it appears isn’t even recognized by the Church.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Father, do you believe that … God has His reasons?

speaker: FATHER MCCUE
line: Yes, I’m certain of it. It’s how He rewards our faith.

speaker: STARKEY
line: Agent Scully? I can’t believe I found you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it?

speaker: STARKEY
line: Agent Mulder’s been trying to reach you. He’s been at the station.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Trying to reach me for what?

speaker: STARKEY
line: The fourth girl – she’s at Father Gregory’s church. Come on. I’ll drive you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There’s no one here.

speaker: STARKEY
line: They must be on their way.

speaker: STARKEY
line: You don’t see her in there? She’s here. I know it.

speaker: STARKEY
line: Agent Scully? Did you find her? Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: My name is Dana. I’m going to get you out of there, okay? I’m not going to hurt you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m going to take you someplace safe.

speaker: STARKEY
line: Where are you going? Where are you taking her?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Everything’s going to be fine.

speaker: STARKEY
line: Bring her to me! Bring her here! Bring me the girl!

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, it’s okay. It’s all right. Stay here. It’s okay. Stay … Just stay here! It’s going to be okay.

speaker: STARKEY
line: Bring her out to me.

speaker: EMILY
line: Mommy?

speaker: EMILY
line: Mommy, let me go. Mommy, please let me go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Emily.

speaker: STARKEY
line: Agent Scully, get her out of there!

speaker: EMILY
line: Mommy, please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Emily? Emily?! Oh, God.

speaker: PRIEST
line: You believed you were releasing her soul to Heaven.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I felt sure of it.

speaker: PRIEST
line: But you still can’t reconcile this belief with the physical fact of her death?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. I thought I could, Father, but I can’t.

speaker: PRIEST
line: Do you believe there is a life after this one?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: PRIEST
line: Are you sure?

speaker: PRIEST
line: Has it occurred to you that maybe this, too, is part of what you were meant to understand?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean, accepting my loss?

speaker: PRIEST
line: Can you accept it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe that’s what faith is.
